examples: Johnson: A sextet there, here's a quartet there.
words.defineEn: six people considered as a unit
words.defineVi: sáu người được coi là một đơn vị

examples: So what looks like one star in the handle of the Big Dipper is actually an intricate sextuple star system!
words.defineVi: có sáu đơn vị hoặc thành phần

examples: The orchestra's rendition of Beethoven's Ninth Symphony was of the first water, with precise execution and a powerful emotional impact that left the audience in awe.
I measured out the precise amount of plain flour needed for the cake recipe I was following.
He measured out the precise amount of white sugar needed for his baking recipe, ensuring the perfect level of sweetness.
The total cost of the project is $10,500, to be precise.
The distance between the two cities is 50 miles, to be precise.
words.defineEn: sharply exact or accurate or delimited
words.defineVi: rõ ràng chính xác hoặc chính xác hoặc phân định

examples: And the genre was christened with a name that has lasted to this day.

Christian holy warriors couldn’t very well sack the largest city in Christendom, could they?
And then they did the impossible: They took Jerusalem, securing it for Christendom and famously killing a lot of people in the al-Asqa mosque.
words.defineEn: the collective body of Christians throughout the world and history (found predominantly in Europe and the Americas and Australia)

examples: And that's one of the things that historians try to disabuse students of, that they're choices that people make.

words.defineEn: to help a person rid themselves of their misconceptions
words.defineVi: để giúp một người thoát khỏi quan niệm sai lầm của họ

examples: One of the big issues that has been revealed is that we're seeing a lot of disaffection and people tend to vote for candidates based on things as basic as what color pantsuit they're wearing.
words.defineEn: a sense of discontent, particularly towards a governing system
words.defineVi: một cảm giác bất mãn, đặc biệt là đối với một hệ thống quản lý

examples: We disagree on most things, but on this question we are at one.
The rest of you may disagree, but I, for one, think we should go ahead with the plan.
He tends to fly off the handle when people disagree with him.
Even if you disagree with someone, you should still lend them your ear and try to understand their point of view.
Scientists disagree about how the universe was created.
There was no point arguing the toss after the goal had been disallowed.
It had been the trimester framework, which disallowed most restrictions in the first trimester.
The judge is making sure that he's weighing the evidence and allowing cases to go forward that should go forward and disallowing cases to go forward that should not.
Even though others may disapprove, he remains determined to do his own thing and pursue his passion for art.
If something causes you to raise an eyebrow or to raise your eyebrows, it causes you to feel surprised or disapproving.
The book was first approved, then disapproved by religious authorities.
They both looked at me as if they strongly disapproved of me.
Netanyahu said he feared his father would disapprove of the gesture.
But the shortcuts they’ll find and the traps they’ll disarm will save you money in the long run.
The idea here is that a laser-focused expression can disarm opponents and make them feel uneasy and anxious.
My fellow citizens, at this hour American and coalition forces are in the early stages of military operations to disarm Iraq, to free its people and to defend the world from grave danger.
words.defineVi: loại bỏ khả năng tấn công từ

words.defineEn: an expression of strong disapproval; pronouncing as wrong or morally culpable
words.defineVi: một biểu hiện của sự phản đối mạnh mẽ; phát âm là sai hoặc có lỗi về mặt đạo đức

examples: The company's financial records were in disarray, and no one knew who was responsible for keeping them organized.

words.defineVi: một trạng thái tinh thần đặc trưng bởi sự thiếu suy nghĩ và hành vi rõ ràng và có trật tự

examples: The KGB was not disbanded.

examples: Jackson ordered that money should be disbursed into local banks, unsurprisingly preferencing ones that were friendly to him.
